title: Serif font — William Christenberry’s Working from Memory
content:
Hello,  
wondering what this font is called?  
Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192652im_/http:/typophile.com/files/51RZOdoh0ML_4386.jpg_SX350_BO1,138,138,138_SH30_BO0,100,100,100_PA7,5,5,10_.jpg)

Font: 

 Adriano (OPTI Castcraft Foundry) 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192652/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: Emma-L

comments.content:
Adriano, by the now defunct OPTI Castcraft Foundry:

[http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=OPTI-Castcra...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192652/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=OPTI-Castcraft%20%2F%20%28Freemium%29&ffam=AdrianoOpti%20-%20Regular&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=6ddbba23a793d361e3db203c6a36a614&wrap=2&text=WilliamChristenberry "http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=OPTI-Castcraft%20%2F%20%28Freemium%29&ffam=AdrianoOpti%20-%20Regular&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=6ddbba23a793d361e3db203c6a36a614&wrap=2&text=WilliamChristenberry")

OPTI was famous for “appropriating” their designs from others—does anyone know if this typeface is a clone of another typeface? The OPTI archive site claims that Adriano is based on Aeterna, but that doesn’t seem to be a match....

EDIT—Aeterna AKA Jost Mediaeval discussed here:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/107102](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192652/http:/typophile.com/node/107102 "http://typophile.com/node/107102")
